Name: Scarab with motif of winged scarab below vulture
Description: Steatite scarab with stylised cutting of head and wing-cases on back, and low relief incised motif on underside, showing a winged scarab beneath a vulture with outstretched wings. The cross-hatching detail within the bodies of the motif is typical of the 2nd Intermediate Period, but the v-mark at the shoulder of the wing-case does not often occur before the New Kingdom.
